dtliExcerpt: The production succeeds in making Ibsen's 1882 drama feel immediate and urgent, though it can't quite overcome the play's inherent didacticism.
bwwExcerpt: Rebecca Lenkiewicz's "new version" of "An Enemy of the People" is yet another attempt to update Henrik Ibsen's smug 1882 satire about a visionary doctor (Boyd Gaines) who becomes a pariah when he makes a discovery that threatens to gut the economy of the hypocriticAl Small town in which he lives. (Yes, the doctor is a self-portrait of the playwright as genius.)
